result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt:
per email from Defense Counsel requesting this case be placed on the speedy disposition calendar before Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Branch 37 notified and confirmed hearing date. New date confirmed with both parties. 
Case placed on Branch 37 calendar for a Plea and Sentencing November 17, 2022 at 2:00pm.

ADOURNED OFF THE RECORD. 
Defendant Martesse A Johnson not in court, in custody.  
Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Martesse A Johnson. 
 Attorney William R. F. Ackell in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case calendared for a Plea and Sentencing Hearing.
Defense counsel request an adjournment. Granted by the Court. 
Case remans calendared in Branch 19 and ordered matter adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Connor Romenesko in court, defendant Martesse A Johnson not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has received discovery and an offer and is requesting a plea and sentencing date.   Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.

HELF OFF THE RECORD:
Case set for status following 22CF1423. Co-defendant does not have counsel. Case is adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
Court ordered defendant to not operate or ride as passenger in any Kia or Hyundai unless own by parents.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with corey G. (owner of Kia Optima); Sophia G.-M. (co-owner of Kia Seltos); Armonda M. (co-owner of Kia Seltos); and Bayshore Mall.

Defendant Martesse A Johnson in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Martesse A Johnson in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Martesse A Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Status conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
